hint.text: An extensive property is a property whose value depends on the quantity or size of matter present in the system whereas an intensive property is a property whose value does not depend on the quantity or size of matter present in the system

solution.text:
An extensive property is a property whose value depends on the quantity or size of matter present in the system whereas an intensive property is a property whose value does not depend on the quantity or size of matter present in the system. Based on that definition, the following properties can be categorized:
  • Extensive Properties : Heat Capacity, Mass, Volume, Enthalpy
  • Intensive Properties : Temperature, Pressure, Density, Molar Heat Capacity
